conclusion: To determine the work done by the gas from state B to state C, analyze the process on the p-V diagram.
The process from state B to state C is isobaric because the pressure remains constant at 0.6p0.
For an isobaric process, the work done W by the gas is given by W = p ΔV, where p is the constant pressure and ΔV is the change in volume.
From the diagram: The volume at state B is V0. The volume at state C is 0.5V0.
The change in volume ΔV is calculated as ΔV = VC - VB = 0.5V0 - V0 = -0.5V0.
Using the formula for work in an isobaric process: W = p ΔV = 0.6p0 × (-0.5V0) = -0.3p0 V0.
The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is -0.3p0 V0.
